oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prize tobacco field in Black Patch, Clarksville, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color tinted photograph of a tobacco field in Clarksville, a region sometimes referred to as "Black Patch" because of the abundance of dark-fired tobacco. Six unidentified people can be seen standing among the tobacco plants. Features a white border and divided back. Postcard printed on linen. [No. C-16] [No. A-5889-N]
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tobacco industry; Tobacco plantations; Laborers
